title: Find an equation from a differential equation

content.description: The weight of a population of yeast is given by a differentiable function y, where y(t) is measured in grams and t is measured in days. The weight of the yeast population increases according to the equation <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mi>k</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> </math>, where k is a constant. At time t = 0, the weight of the yeast population is 120 grams and is increasing at the rate of 24 grams per day.
content.question: Which of the following is an expression for y(t) ?

skill.text: Skill 3.G: Confirm that solutions are accurate and appropriate.
